title: Isolating $$t$$
text: The first step in solving for $$t$$ is to divide both sides by the coefficient of the e term, which is $$3$$.

title: Dividing by Coefficient
text: What is the value of the right hand side when dividing both sides of the equation by 20?

title: Variable in Exponent
text: To get the variable out of the exponent, take the natural log of both sides.

title: Inverse Functions
text: Since ln(x) and $$e^x$$ are inverse functions, taking the natural log of a term with e leaves only the exponent left.

title: Isolate $$t$$
text: To isolate $$t$$ by itself, divide both sides by the coefficient of $$t$$.

title: Dividing by Smaller than $$1$$
text: Dividing by $$0.5$$ is the same thing as multiplying both sides by $$2$$, since $$2\times0.5=1$$ that cancels.
